citations.narrative:
A current record of birds on hand was not available for review during this inspection. The facility maintains and exhibits
chickens, ducks, peacocks, geese, turkey, and pheasant.
Failure to maintain these records can make it difficult to track animals being used in regulated activities to ensure their
humane care and use.
The facility must maintain records containing the required information for animals which fully and correctly disclose the
number of animals held, owned, and acquired or disposed of including births and deaths.
Correct by: July 9, 2024

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility provides enrichment for the birds but a written environmental enhancement plan for birds that documents the
appropriate provisions to provide enrichment and special considerations and is approved by the attending veterinarian
has not been developed by the facility.
Failure to document an environmental enhancement plan can result in birds not receiving adequate enrichment which can
lead to behavior, social, health, and other psychological problems.
Facilities must develop, document, and follow an environment enhancement plan to promote the psychological well-being
of the birds.
Correct by: July 9, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
